course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Mechanics of Materials
course.description: Analysis of stress, strain and deformation; linear and non-linear material behavior; strain energy; bending of beams, deflection; stability and buckling of compression members; shear and torsional stresses.

reviews.author: I Want 1st Hon!
reviews.title: Very Light Workload Course. Study in CAS approach (Using calculator)
reviews.comment_content:
Personally, I DON'T recommend you rush through this fall course, i.e. study in spring. Unless, you have studied CIVL2110 early (in year 1 spring) and got a grade that you satisfied with it.

Only 15 students study in this semester (However, two of them failed since they didn't show up in final exam)

Ch. 1: Introduction
Ch. 2: Stress and Strain; Axial Loading
Ch. 3: Torsion
Quiz 1: (Chp 1-3, skipped power of torsional shaft) (Very difficult)
------------------------------
Ch. 4: Pure Bending + Review of Statics: Beam analysis (singularity functions will be introduced)
Ch. 5: Analysis and Design of Beams for Bending (**Most important in Quiz 2, especially the singularity function!!!!)
Quiz 2: (Ch. 4-5: RC beam & Shear/Moment Diagram w or w/o self weight and its design criteria (what is the minimum & economical S? Check table!)) (Very easy!)
------------------------------
Ch. 6: Shearing Stresses in Beams
Ch. 7: Transformation of Stress and Strain (only learn the equations for principal stresses, and its angles; mention Mohr's circle but not in exam; only test in MC)
Ch. 9: Deflection of Beams (Only learn statically determinate beam; skipped indeterminate, moment area theorem, method of superposition) (**Most important, especially the singularity function and plotting graph!!!!)
Final: (Ch. 1-7, 9; mainly focused in Ch. 2, 5, 7, 9) (Quite difficult in my opinion)

P.S. Some questions in quiz 2 & final exam MUST use CAS calculator.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For tutorial: I only attended two or three tutorials, and I heard from my friend who also studied with me said one of the tutors finished the tutorial in 15 minutes and then leave XP
While I think the first tutor (from 清華大學, she studied under a strict system, hence she corrected paper very strictly (as you can see in the 1st quiz...))

For Dr Hu's teaching, I think it is good and easygoing. He taught us both traditional approach (as Tim Tse did in Spring), and the "efficient" approach (using CAS Calculator). He exchanged the lecture and tutorial time (originally 9am for lecture).

Some lectures In CIVL barn, because of the easier access to Ti-CAS software, instead of using the handheld. Some students talked to him after each lecture, and I was not sure what they were talking about...Maybe about the lecture slides?

Calculators are loaned to us, so we don't need to buy one.
reviews.comment_grading:
Only 2-3 out of 15 students are given A range, i.e. follow the UST grading scheme.

P.S. As most of you reading this review WILL NOT normally take this course in fall semester (unless you follow the accelerated course pattern), I will just briefly write down the approximating mark for the mean.

Quiz 1 (15%): 38/100 (Mean: ~28, SD:~very high)
Quiz 2 (15%): 100/100 (Mean: ~74, SD: normal)
Final (60%): Unknown/100 (Mean & SD unknown, since he released the grade before showing the final mark)
Participation (10%): Unknown/10 (Who knows...)
Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely light workload, with NO assignment.
Dr Hu sent us some practice exercises from previous years, and we only practice on those.

We study less content than spring sem's CIVL2120, since we were taught in CAS approach with many demonstration. Hence, we skipped one chapter and brief taught in some chapters.

reviews.author: HKUST civl
reviews.title: 輕鬆 超靚龜 我愛Thomas 最正嘅course，沒有之一
reviews.comment_content:
ch1 concept of stress
ch2 stress and strain
ch3 torsion
ch4 pure bending
ch5 analysis and design of beams for bending
ch6 shear stress
ch7-8 stress transformation、principal stress & mohr's circle
ch9 deflection

ch1,2基本嘢，應該都學過曬，冇難度
ch3，4新嘢，尤其bending，之後啲course會用返，concept我覺得系最難，冇操過題，基本上exam系會完全唔識做
ch5 唔知學咗啲咩新嘢，都系畫下shear and branding diagram，不過你fall讀，Thomas會教你用埋CAS cal機（2160嗰部，無敵神器）table搵返適合嘅beam，再計下啲bending同shear，可以溝埋ch 3 4一齊考
ch7-8 同2110 用mohr‘s circle搵inertia基本上一樣，只不過x同y axis轉咗normal stress 同 shear stress，一兩堂教曬，final都好似冇考到，太簡單
ch9 整個course嘅重頭戲，計beam嘅deflection due to bending，yr3 3310會再深讀，你2120讀得好，基本上3310冇難度
reviews.comment_teaching: Thomas畀我嘅感覺系chill，好chill，佛系教書，純正英文，正常語速，聽得好舒服（佢為咗上zoom堂買咗支二千幾嘅咪，收音的確好正），之前civl2160 都系佢教statistics，嗰時第一次用部CAS cal機，又難用，我部dse Casio cal機好用過佢，感覺佢好hard sell，多舊魚，睇唔到部cal機有乜咁好用，讀完2120，愛了，部cal機簡直神器，佢develop咗個方法，用step function 同 delta function去express啲point load，之後就可以直接用佢砌program直接integrate個loading出shear 嘅function 再in多次出bending嘅function，oh my god，快x到，尤其有幾個support+point load + distributed loading嘅beam，你讀過2110就知要分幾段去搵啲shear 同 bending 有幾煩同幾慢，用佢個方法+program，幾複雜嘅beam都系五分鐘內搞掂，cls，顛覆了我的認知，ch9嘅deflection都系in多兩次，再solve啲unknown constant，有部cal機幫你做曬啲tedious嘅algebra，基本上都系做多兩三分鐘就搞掂，如果你同時讀3310，你會發覺3310教嘅方法（energy method, virtual work, conjugate beam method, ），基本上都會被部cal機秒殺，唔系講笑，如果唔系3310個final唔畀用電腦版cal機，3個鐘嘅exam我可以1個鐘做曬。thomas最後會教下用部cal機solve啲indeterminate beam problem（3310重頭戲），都系嗰句，學咗Thomas嘅cal機方法，你基本上系唔會想用3310教嘅方法，起碼快五倍以上。可惜Thomas系教fall sem，正常應該系spring sem讀，除非你系fail過 讀慢咗 讀快咗 先會take佢fall sem嘅2120， spring sem系唔會用部cal機，我聽身邊啲frd講好難，final exam mean得個位數，唔知系咪用咗部cal機，我就覺得個course好簡單，利申 非學霸。
reviews.comment_grading:
好grade，真系好好grade
midterm 1: 54/100 mean： 46
midterm 2:  85/100 mean ：73
final 108/100 20 bonus，mean ：99
grade：A-

6個人讀，其中一個基本上absent曬啲exam，所以mean拉低咗，其他人全部都高過我，應該唔系A就A+，Thomas真心好人，見佢第一個midterm得十幾分，第二個midterm absent，改grading policy幫佢，final過60%就淨計最高分嗰個midterm，條友最尾居然absent埋final，cls，心痛Thomas一番好意
reviews.comment_workload: 冇hw，淨系兩個midterm+1個final，上堂都好chill，唔take attendance，試過得我一個人上堂，堂上就go through一次concept，再step by step講幾個example，除非你完全唔聽，完全唔試做，否則好難會聽唔明

reviews.author: GUOSHANGFENG
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1 Concept of Stress
Chapter 2 Axial Loading
Chapter 3 Torsion
Chapter 4 & 5 Pure Bending & Shear and Bending Diagrams
Chapter 6 Shearing stresses in Beams
Chapter 7 & 8 Analysis of Stress and Strain
Chapter 9 Deflections of Beams
Syllabus of midterm(Chapter 1-4)
Syllabus of final exam(All)

There are a lot of extra exercises which I suggest you try them before the exam. It will help you to clarify the concept. However, the mid term and final would be more difficult than the exercises. mid term and final like combining two or three different questions from various topics. In my semester, one of the mid term question came from the tutorial so do not miss tutorial!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor explain the concept very clear and the pace of teaching is slowly sometimes. TSE will recap the concept he has taught every lecture so you don't need to worry  that you can't keep pace with the lessons. BTW, I still remember that TSE was really happy after seeing that we were complaining how difficult the final exam is.

For the TA, I admire the first TA named LI Yutong taught in a very good way and he is really humorous. One of the mid term questions came from what he has taught in the tutorial, so you know.... ^v^.  The second TA taught us in a ordinary way but he is willing to answer our questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say the grading is quite good.
I got below mean 0.5 SD in the mid term exam but I finally obtain B+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. 4 homework in total and you can find the answers for every questions in the sources.

reviews.author: ChristopherWong
reviews.comment_content:
Analysis of stress, strain and deformation; linear and non-linear material behavior; strain energy; bending of beams, deflection; stability and buckling of compression members; shear and torsional stresses.
Chapter 1 Concept of Stress
Chapter 2 Axial Loading
Chapter 3 Torsion
Chapter 4 & 5 Pure Bending & Shear and Bending Diagrams
Chapter 6 Shearing stresses in Beams
Chapter 7 & 8 Analysis of Stress and Strain
Chapter 9 Deflections of Beams
Syllabus of midterm(Chapter 1-4)
Syllabus of final exam(All)

Many extra practice are given before midterm and final exams.
For midterm,the format of the questions are not similar ,that is why the mean of the mid term is so low.
For final, there is enough time for you to finish as long as you are well prepared.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture video are recorded so you may not have to attend the lectures.Not too much extra information given on lecture.For tutorial ,it is taught by two tutors which each of them was responsible for before and after the midterm.
Usually very few students would take the lecture at the midterm period.
Lecturer is passionate and can explain lecturer notes precisely,it is advised to go to the lecture if you are free.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:     
Assignments (20%) + Mid-term exam (25%) + Final exam (55%) = 100%
midterm:58/100    mean at around:52
final:not released
4 assignment:95/100+90/100+97/100+93/100
final grading:B
reviews.comment_workload: Actually very little workload,just need to finish 4 assignments after the lecture have finished the covered chapter.Assignments are normally given a time period around one week ,sometimes more to do the assignments.For those who are confident ,you may not have to go to the lecture,since some of my friends can still get an A without attending any classes.

reviews.author: andy1234
reviews.title: Analysis of stress, strain and deformation; linear and non-linear material behavior; strain energy; bending of beams, deflection; stability and buckling of compression members; shear and torsional stresses.
reviews.comment_content: The content involves advance knowledge of Civl2110, like the bending moment diagram. The notes contain very detail with examples, solutions and detail explanation. The content is quite difficult and complicated so you will easily be lost during the lessons. The notes in the examples are quite important for your understanding of the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is quite clear. The prof is willing to explain to you if you have questions. But mostly I have to revise the notes again and again to understand the content as it is complicated.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments (20%) + Mid-term exam (25%) + Final exam (55%).
There are 4 assignments and they are really important in this course in terms of grading and it is really demanding, make sure you remember to hand them in on time. The mid term and final may involves examples in the notes or textbook. Make sure you have seen them all. There are voluntarily PRS questions which add 3-5% bonus mark to your overall marks. Mean around B-.
reviews.comment_workload: The course is very demanding as you have to attend the lessons and answer the prs questions to get the bonus marks. You also have to use so many time to to revise the notes to understand the concept and spend lots of time to do the assignments. And you have to repeat this process before mid term and final exam.

reviews.author: Troy
reviews.comment_content: 主要都係講下torsion, pure bending, stress, strain, Mohr circle同deflection of beam。當中Mohr circle比較重要，因為之後唔少course都要用返。而deflection of beam主要教moment area method，將會係呢個course既重點，所以一定要清concept。但其實3310會教其他方法去solve deflection of beam，例如conjugate beam同force method，而且仲好用，都唔明點解2120淨係教moment area method...
reviews.comment_teaching: 好用心教，你問問題佢實肯教你，而且講得算清楚
reviews.comment_grading:
聽人講就比較爛grade，大家好自為之啦
20% assignment
25% midterm
55% final
不過最緊要係温熟deflection of beam，因為佢會係final最難果題
reviews.comment_workload: 如果想攞好grade咁workload都幾重，因為都要做多d先領略到moment area method既精粹

reviews.author: JC
reviews.comment_content:
呢個系structural series既第2個course。statics讀佐既first moment, second moment, mohr's circle, 全部都要用翻曬，仲要學埋用佢來計axial force, shear force, bending moment, torsion, displacement，簡單來講就係去analysis普通beam係loading之下既變化。

雖然CIVL2120既concept唔難，但係exam question可以出到好難，最好睇多d examples。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tim Cheng 好好人，難明既位佢通常都會講幾次，每堂都有break，算係civil入面上得比較輕鬆既科。PRS Quiz問題多數考common sense，tricky但唔難，亦唔計分。另外佢會每一堂用around 15minutes總結上堂既内容，之後再講新野，個人覺得幾有用，易明d。佢都好中意將chapter review 同sample questions upload上LMES，有d example系佢上堂無講過，自己睇下都學到野。

Tutorial 個人覺得基本上無用，都係講下example，大部分時間都係自己做，老實講，自己睇都快過佢。
reviews.comment_grading: 好grade，Assignments (20%) ，Mid-term exam (25%)，Final exam (55%)。Assignment有5份，唔難。至於考試，Midterm有幾易final就有幾難。最後幾日多d睇example啦！
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔大，每份assignment大概10題左右，簡單題目。

reviews.author: CJLI
reviews.title: Easy with calculator
reviews.comment_content:
1  Introduction
2  Axial Loading
3  Torsion
4  Pure bending
5  Shear, Bending Diagrams
6  Shearing Stresses
7  Stress Transformation
8  Principal Stresses
9  Beam Deflections
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is summer course, each lecture is 3 hours. A bit boring and it is easy to fall asleep listening to Thomas speaking.

The CAS calculator helps a lot on solving beam problem, it is fast and efficient. The course ppt provides sufficient example on how to use the calculator software.

Tutorial is useful, notes and problem samples are helpful for preparing exams. TAs are helpful as well.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost none.

The project is the only thing you need to do.
1. Choose an indeterminate beam problem that is complicated enough.
2. Do it with the calculator method. (You will find it much easier than the traditional method)
3. Compare the diagram you get with the solution.
4. Present the process as if you are teaching another person to use the calculator.

reviews.author: Wu
reviews.comment_content:
主要係分析
1.個structure某個point承受到嘅力
2.個beam點彎曲
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof上堂教得好認真, 不過佢冇覆過我email
落堂之後有疑問可以去請教兩位TA, 特別是 TANG Yihong, 每次都覆得勁detail
reviews.comment_workload:
還好, 比起其他course算少
基本上都易跟進度

reviews.author: Watermelon
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1 Concept of Stress
Chapter 2 Axial Loading
Chapter 3 Torsion
Chapter 4 & 5 Pure Bending
Chapter 6 Shearing Stresses in Beams
Chapter 7 & 8 Analysis of Stress and Strain
Chapter 9 Deflections of Beams
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. 教得幾好，每堂都會有recap，ppt有唔少examples

反而tutorial好悶
reviews.comment_grading:
In-Class Participation (5%)
Assignments (30%)
Final Exam (65%)

(因為疫情關係，取消咗midterm)

/

Assignment: 97/100 (mean: 92)
Final: unknown

Overall: B-

冇咗midterm，要all-in final攞命博

reviews.author: Arnold hui
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1

Concept of Stress

Introduction to mechanic of materials
Stresses in the members of a structure
Normal stress, shearing stress, and bear stress
Stress under general loading conditions
Allowable stresses and allowable loads


Chapter 2

Axial Loading

Normal strain under axial loading
Stress-strain diagram
Hooke’s law and modulus of elasticity
Poisson’s ratio
Chapter 3

Torsion

Torsional deformations of a circular shaft
Stresses in the elastic range
Angle of twist in the elastic range
Thin-walled hollow shafts


Chapter 4 & 5

Pure Bending

Symmetric member in pure bending
Deformations of a symmetric member
Relations among load, shear, and bending moment
Shear and bending-diagrams
Design of beams for bending


Chapter 6

Shearing Stresses in Beams

Shear on the face of a beam element
Shearing stresses in a beam
Longitudinal shear on a beam element of arbitrary shape
Shearing stresses in thin-walled members


Chapter 7 & 8

Analysis of Stress and Strain

Transformation of plane stress
Principal stresses and maximum shear stresses
Mohr circle for plane stress
Stresses in thin-walled pressure vessels
Hooke’s law for plane stress
Stresses under combined loadings


Chapter 9

Deflections of Beams

Differential equations of the deflection curve
Deflections by integration
Method of superposition
Moment-area method
Bending-moment diagrams by parts
Maximum deflection
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures are well structured with
1) a brief recap of the previous lecture
2) Introduction of a new topic/ going through different kinds of example.
3) a short summary
reviews.comment_grading:
In-Class Participation (5%) + Assignments (20%) + Midterm Exam (20%) + Final Exam (55%) = 100%

I got full mark for  in-class participation, assignments, midterm and got 20/100 for final.
Final grade : A
The midterm is easy, question types are similar to lecture examples. However, final exam is a massacre. I’ve gone through all examples for at least 3 times, still I couldn’t even solve part(a) of all final questions. A kind reminder for you all, try to write down equation that maybe used in each step and it’s okay to have the wrong number , it may get you some pts.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal workload with 4 assignment. Please be reminder that each assignment takes some time to complete.

reviews.author: 準雷
reviews.title: 考試地獄級既難但唔算爛grade既structural course
reviews.comment_content:
Statics部分內容呢個course要用返
Chapter 1 Concept of Stress
Chapter 2 Axial Loading
Chapter 3 Torsion
Chapter 4 Pure Bending
Chapter 5 Shear & Bending Moment Diagram
----------------Midterm Exam------------------
Chapter 6 Shearing Stresses in Beams
Chapter 7 Stress Transformation
Chapter 8 Principal Stresses
Chapter 9 Beam Deflection
----------Final Exam (cumulative)-----------
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. TSE 上堂既解說都算清晰
每堂開始之前都會有recap
幫到你跟返進度
Notes有哂Example同step by step solution
考試前會比一堆extra exercise
溫書既材料應該算足夠
不過都係有error無修正到
reviews.comment_grading:
In-Class Participation (5%)
唔知點計 我比較少係chat room講野 當3/5

Assignments x4 (20%)
有source 所以滿分 20/20

Midterm Exam (Closed Book and no formula sheet) (20%)
75分鐘3題 textbook到抽出黎 唔太難
My Score: 24/25

Final Exam (Closed Book but formula sheet will be given) (55%)
地獄級 3個鐘4題
唔知係咪因為online teaching防cheat所以整到超難
同平時做既練習係兩回事 D case係完全未見過
My Score: 24.5/100 (但之後收埋唔比人睇)

Overall: 55.675%
Grade: A
我都唔明佢點分grade
可能Final Exam個mean得20甚至仲低
reviews.comment_workload:
有少少重
Assignment基本上都係抄source架啦
不過要明白個做法同concept先得
唔好只係死抄
因為D source答案都有好多bug同錯
考試要用多少少時間清concept同做題
因為D內容都算多同少少深

reviews.author: chpoonag
reviews.title: Easy Midterm, Difficult Final.
reviews.comment_content:
The following content discusses the assignments and exams.

Assignment problems were just the same as those in the previous years'. So you can just copy from the solutions but be aware that there can be many mistakes in the solutions. So, think when you are copying. Don't just blindly copy.

Midterm exam was very similar to assignment / tutorial problems in terms of the difficulty. Therefore, make sure you will not make any careless mistakes in calculations. There were a total of 3 questions and each contained 3 to 4 sub-questions.

As for the final exam, there were a total of 4 questions and the last sub-question in each question was told to be challenging (and it was in fact). We may not have seen these questions in tutorial classes or homework.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture videos were recorded but released some days before midterm/final exam so you had better attend the lessons.

Another reason for attending lessons is that the lecturer may add something onto the lecture slides but they would not be updated.

Only during the midterm/final exam period would fewer students attend lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (25%): 95/100, mean 52, s.d. 15
Assignment (4x5%): All full mark except one (93/100)
Final exam: not shown
Grade: A

Many students doubted that the mean should be higher. No paper checking session was held. He replied a request for paper checking that the marking scheme was set by him and thus there should be no problems.

As for the assignments, most of the students got 9X or 100.

In the final exam, note that there were some problems on concepts instead of merely calculations, unlike the midterm exam.

I skipped almost all last sub-question in each question given that I cannot get all correct for other sub-questions. It seems this is the reason why I cannot get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, personally. You should have at least 1 week to finish (or copy answers) the assignments. Usually, there were about 15 calculation questions in each assignment which costed me 1 - 2 days to copy while ensuring the answers were correct.

reviews.author: vera
reviews.title: 奇怪
reviews.comment_content:
Review of Statics
Structure Free-Body Diagram
Stress Analysis
Normal Stress
Shearing Stress
Bearing Stress in Connections
Stress Analysis & Design Example
Stress in Two Force Members
Stress on an Oblique Plane
Maximum Stresses
reviews.comment_teaching: prof長的超好看！！！穿襯衫超帥！！！教的也很棒！！！英语非常好！！！
reviews.comment_grading: midterm题简单到爆炸，给的时间很多但是几乎所有人都会丢一分因为有陷阱，一定要注意不能信ta，midterm有一道题给的条件不够！！！然后他说要我们自己写出来！！！几乎所有人都是39 out of 40. 至于final，又是civil的一门不出分直接出grade的课。很多人抱怨烂grade。
reviews.comment_workload: 不大，作业大家基本都差不多满分。

reviews.author: ffskw
reviews.title: 正正常常
reviews.comment_content:
Chapters:
1  Introduction
2  Axial Loading
3  Torsion
4  Pure bending
5  Shear, Bending Diagrams
6  Shearing Stresses
7  Stress Transformation
8  Principal Stresses
9  Beam Deflections
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture:
TSE Kam Tim 教得幾好 解釋得幾清晰 仲要有好多examples幫你去理解

不過佢會成堂都係同一個速度同語氣 令我覺得有啲悶

佢上堂頭10分鐘會攞嚟recap上一堂學過嘅嘢 令你記得返學過啲咩 份recap會upload返上canvas 我覺得幾好

佢去到課堂嘅一半會有5分鐘休息 播啲偉大科學家嘅介紹片 都幾得意

Tutorial:
至於Tutorial基本上除咗頭兩堂之外我都冇上過
我覺得條友講嘢口音重仲要悶
不過啲tutorial notes可能幫到你做功課
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
In-Class Participation (5%)
上堂+開camera
My Score: Full Mark

Assignments (30%)
有4份Assignment 頭兩份跟住lecture notes做都幾輕鬆 後面兩份我覺得好難就用咗好多時間做 有source就好做好多

Assignment 1 (Ch 1-3) - 80/80 ; Mean : 76.54/80
Assignment 2 (Ch 4-5) - 72/80 ; Mean : 72.9/80

reviews.author: drew.ng
reviews.title: Tim Tse is a c*nt (pass it on)
reviews.comment_content: Please read others. Loves to point, no examples. Practice questions are simple but exams will come at your anus like a freight train.
reviews.comment_teaching: He loves his pointer and never writes anything down. Absolutely useless when it comes to asking for help because he keeps it so short and simple you just stand there and ????????.
reviews.comment_grading: I somehow fucked my midterm with 4% but pulled it back with my final to get a D. I assume my final mustve been on mean. I literally begged him to let me all-in final but this egotistical and sadistic c*nt told me to suck it up and perform better in the finals or else it wont be 'fair' to other students. BRO I HAVE 4%. I dont know how I can be a threat to other students while being class minimum. This some bulllsh.
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments given =/= exam questions. The exam questions are a lot harder. If you ask your older chings for their USTHING grading curve by year, this course/semester is probably the lowest in the 4 years due to this course.

reviews.comment_grading:
In-Class Participation (5%)
Assignments (30%)
Final Exam (65%)
原本應該系會有mid term 但係今個sem取消左

Assignment唔知幾多分 佢冇講
Final一樣冇出分 直接出龜
Final份野基本上就會系上堂啲野 唔會差好遠
不過會考翻少少2110啲已有知識

唔知道佢算唔好算好grade

workload 好細 基本上有上堂 自己做下assignment都搞得掂
